meanings.definition: The quality or state of being unable to be repealed or revoked.
meanings.sent1: The irrepealability of the law ensured that it could not be changed.
meanings.sent2: The irrepealability of the decision meant it was final and could not be undone.
meanings.sent3: The irrepealability of the rule made it as unchangeable as the color of the sky.
meanings.sent4: Her commitment to the project had an irrepealability that was as strong as steel.
meanings.sent5: The irrepealability of the contract was as firm as a mountain, impossible to alter.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of being irrevocable or unchangeable.
meanings.sent1: The irrepealability of the promise meant it could not be taken back.
meanings.sent2: His irrepealability in his beliefs made him a steadfast individual.
meanings.sent3: The irrepealability of the tradition added a sense of permanence to the event.
meanings.sent4: The irrepealability of time's passage was evident in the changing seasons.
meanings.sent5: The irrepealability of history's lessons serves as a reminder for future generations.
